intro: Seseli vulgatum, commonly known as common sesel, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbel-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soil. It blooms from late spring to early summer, producing small white or pale yellow flowers that attract pollinators. Seseli vulgatum is often used in herbal medicine for its potential health benefits.
